entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: aw

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: scrubbedentry he goes through a lot of moods dealing with the people in his life

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: awesome

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: do you find it easy to be a parent

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: no i have had some issues some nervous breakdowns actually and right now my son is staying with his dad so no i am a single mom it was the hardest thing i think in the world is being a single mom

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: yeah

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: so

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: how do you cope with them

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: how do i cope

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: yeah

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: well right now i did not have very many good coping skills or mechanisms so that was the problem

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: what is the best thing about being a parent

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: it is so spontaneous like the stuff that comes outta kids mouths sometimes and the stuff that they do and just brings a smile to your face

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: can you give me an example of that

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: well when my son was younger once we were just sitting around the house and he comes and he starts doing my hair and he says to me mom i want you to put on some lipstick and high heels and ponytails so you can go out and get married and find a boyfriend so

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: laughter

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: yeah it is pretty spontaneous things like that happen that my kid is telling me i need to not be single anymore

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: okay what is the hardest thing about being a parent

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: the hardest thing not wanting to screw it up i feel a lot of stress and pressure that every little thing is gonna make make a difference and matter in what kind of person my kid turns out to be and so it is a lot of stress on yourself

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: that sounds really hard

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: yeah

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: do you think that maybe you are being a little hard on yourself

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: yeah definitely

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: what are some ways that you are different as a parent than your parents

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: h i think i am different from my mom because i am a little bit more tolerant of that spontaneous interaction i welcome it you know i welcome getting to know who my child is right now and not try to mold them into somebody that i want them to be but just see them become the best child that they can be the best adult that they can be without molding them in that direction necessarily

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: yeah

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: into a different person

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: h

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: so

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: sometimes when i am feeling tense i turn on the fish tank screensaver hey i know it is not hawaii but it is the best i have got what do you do to relax

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: well i have tried to meditate sometimes but i do not really stick with it often enough i have tried to like go for walks but i do not always do that and i do not always stick with it so

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: h

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: yeah that is about it

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: how are you at controlling your temper

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: i would say i am a little below average meaning that i get angry more than most people do i think

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: when was the last time you argued with someone and what was it about

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: h last night but it was on the telephone i was arguing with my husband we have my sister lives with us and she lives with us in a very small room with a small apartment i should say and she is got four people living in in one room so it is kind of stressful it is really crowded and my husband is stressed out about it and you know i am just saying to him that i told you so i told you if my sister moved in here then there was gonna be a mess in the house and she is gonna be asking for things you do not really wanna do that is just how my sister is so the house is messy and it is crowded and every day they are asking for rides and my husband he is avoiding coming home because all these people are home and he does not wanna be there anymore and i am just saying that he is gonna have to find a way to deal with it because he asked for it in my opinion so h

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: that sucks

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: it does

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: oh no

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: yeah they are gonna be saying that i am not a good mom because i believe in having boundaries and we have very different ideas about child raising she is my stepmom she is my dad is fifth wife and she is she really does not she is really far removed from how i was raised and i wanna raise my child more similar to how i was raised where you are we had some independence and we had some boundaries and we knew what the rules were and what was expected of us and with my stepmom she xxx no rules she has no expectation she just wants him to run wild and have everything that he wants and that is fine when you are a grandparent but the problem is that i live with them sometimes and when i am in the same house with them they should be following my rules and not trying to go and break all of my rules anyway

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: right that makes sense

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: yeah

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: how did you feel in that moment

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: in that moment just really frustrated because they do not listen to me i feel disrespected i feel like invisible i feel just angry that they are taking away my right to parent and it is something that i worked really hard to do i went to school and i studied child development i have read all the magazines and i have read the books and i am really i know what i am talking about i feel confident in my parenting skills and my parenting abilities and to have these people that have not done the same thing and worked as hard as i have to be a good parent try and tell me that i am a bad parent it is really hard to believe so i feel very disrespected unacknowledged angry frustrated all those things

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: yeah i am sorry how easy is it for you to get a good night is sleep

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: i take i take benadryl to help me sleep and i am so my doctor gave me that she gave me benadryl told me that i could take it to help me sleep and last night i was crying before i went to sleep so sometimes these thoughts start running through your head at night when you are in bed but i tried to push them out and then i got up and i took my benadryl so i could go to sleep more easily

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: h are they triggered by something

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: yeah i am always thinking about my son how i wish he was with me and how unfair everything is that is happening and like i do not deserve to have my son taken from me because i am a really good mom you know

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: yeah

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: and i am too hard on myself so but i am a good mom and i feel confident that i am a good mom i just i do not really have the money to take care of my son like my dad the son is dad does he has more money than me and right now i am trying to be okay with it because i know he can do more for him financially than i could but that does not mean i am not a good mom h

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: yeah how have you been feeling lately

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: i am pretty depressed i am on anti depressants i take wellbutrin i been on them for a couple weeks now i think they are working i do not know i am not as down as i was i mean i got here today i got dressed i made it out and i am here today so not that bad

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: what got you to seek help

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: h my husband complains a lot he says i am not the same person that i was when he married me he said i was fun and i was positive and i was all these other optimistic things that is another thing he was on the phone telling me last night and and i am not those things anymore which is true i mean we got married a year ago and then my son was taken shortly after and it was just such a shock and i have just been trying to get back from it but it is been hard

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: i understand did you think you had a problem before you found out

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: did i think i had a problem before i found out found out what

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: what were your symptoms

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: oh yeah like crying a lot something like i cry all the time it does not take much for me to cry i am just crying thinking about crying but like my family would invite me to family events and i would go and just just cry because my son was not there or i do not know it is just all the crying i think and like i said my husband letting me know that i am not the same person so he is disappointed and i feel bad even that i am not the same person that he he knew i feel bad about that too another thing i am feeling bad about you know

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: do you still go to therapy now

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: yes i do i try

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: do you feel like therapy is useful

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: do i feel like the therapy is useful yeah it is nice to talk about your problems i go in there and i cry every week so at least i have a set time every week where i can go in and cry that is i mean it is a release to be able to cry sometimes i feel better afterwards

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: that is good

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: yeah and she helps me make decisions you know help me to be more proactive in my life

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: like what

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: well i am looking for jobs and things like that and she gives me ideas of why do not you work here or why do not you work there or have you thought about this or that you know and then she said something about why do not you go back to school and so i went and applied to go back to school you know i am not doing much with my life and sitting around all day is not helping my depression any either so i am trying to find a work and i applied for college in the fall i got accepted to dominguez hills so i may be going back to school in the fall right now i am still looking for work but she helps me with that kinda stuff just giving me ideas that life is not over that there is still more you know i could be doing

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: that is good right

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: with life life yeah

entries.speaker: ellie
entries.text: tell me about the last time you felt really happy

entries.speaker: participant
entries.text: everything is always bittersweet i do not know last time i was really happy i do not know
